result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel M Short was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Threats to Injure/Accuse of Crime, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.30(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: denying Defendant's motion to withdraw no contest plea
Kettle Moraine Correctional

Defendant Samuel M Short appeared by video conference from Kettle Moraine Correctional. Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions Defendant, who wants to proceed without counsel at this time, but may request counsel if motion is granted. Court reviews motion, questions Defendant, who makes statement regarding incident and injuries received. Court makes statement, finds that Defendant has not produced any evidence that he did not enter plea voluntarily, denies motion.
from State requesting video appearance for Defendant
State's Response to Motion to Withdraw Plea and Reopen Case
Video conference has been confirmed with Kettle Moraine for 5/25.
Kettle Moraine Correctional

Defendant Samuel M Short appeared by video conference from Kettle Moraine Correctional. Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews Defendant's Motion. State intends to file written response, to be filed by May 18. Court will allow brief arguments, intends to present oral ruling at next hearing.  Oral ruling scheduled for May 25, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Must have DOC # per DOC policy
Status conference on May 3, 2017 at 11:00 am.

by Defendant to withdraw no contest plea and reopen case

Defendant Samuel M Short in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Defendant Samuel M Short in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, receipt of PSI, recommendation contained therein. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Bond no longer in effect.
to Transport

Defendant Samuel M Short in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Defendant Samuel M Short in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 1, 4. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 1, 4. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Counts 2, 3, 5 are dismissed but read in for sentencing and/or restitution. Parties request PSI. Court orders PSI. Bond continues as is.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas. Plea hearing set for April 23, 2105 at 9:30.
by State

Defendant Samuel M Short in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.
Defendant was fingerprinted on 3/30/15.

Defendant Samuel M Short in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Defendant Samuel M Short in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defense last week. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Defense advises that Defendant will waive time limits for prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Court addresses no contact modification from victim. Defense does not want to address that at this time.  Waiver of Prelim scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

No Contact Modification Request from victim. Per State, object to any modification of bond due to witness intimidation and history of past domestic violence by Defendant with Ms. Short. Per Court, will take up at Mr. Short's next hearing.
No contact direct or indirect with SS, her family or her residence. Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.

Defendant Samuel M Short appeared by video conference. Attorney Gregory A. Gerbers appeared in Court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 3/30/15, 10:00.
